notes: Baicker et al. (2014) 'The Impact of Medicaid on Labor Market Activity and Program Participation: Evidence from the Oregon Health Insurance Experiment.' AER P&P. Uses the Oregon Health Insurance Experiment lottery as random assignment. ITT regressions of treatment (lottery selection) on labor/benefit outcomes with lottery-draw FE (nnn*) controls and optional lagged outcome controls, clustered at household (reservation_id). IV/LATE estimated using 2SLS where lottery is instrument for actual Medicaid enrollment. Data not publicly available (SSA administrative records).

design_audit.sample_condition: sample_ssa==1 (matched to SSA, in analysis sample)

claim_object.outcome_concept: Employment and earnings (any earnings indicator, total earnings, earnings above FPL)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Intent-to-treat effect of Medicaid lottery selection on labor force participation and earnings
claim_object.target_population: Low-income uninsured adults in Oregon who signed up for Medicaid lottery, matched to SSA administrative data

baseline_specs.label: Table1-AnyEarn
baseline_specs.notes: ITT: reg any_earn2009 treatment nnn* any_earn2007 [pw=weight_ssa_admin], cluster(reservation_id)

baseline_specs.label: Table1-Earn
baseline_specs.notes: ITT: reg earn2009 treatment nnn* earn2007 [pw=weight_ssa_admin], cluster(reservation_id)

baseline_specs.label: Table1-EarnAboveFPL
baseline_specs.notes: ITT: reg earn_ab_fpl_adj_2009 treatment nnn* earn_ab_fpl_adj_2007 [pw=weight_ssa_admin], cluster(reservation_id)

constraints.notes: Minimum controls = nnn* lottery draw dummies (8, always required for design integrity). Maximum is nnn* + lagged outcome + lottery_list covariates (8 + 1 + 9 = 18). The paper's robustness checks run: (1) nnn* only (no lagged outcome), (2) nnn* + lagged outcome (baseline), (3) nnn* + lagged outcome + lottery_list demographics. Lottery draw dummies (nnn*) are mandatory for RCT design integrity.

canonical.notes: Cluster at the household (reservation_id) -- the randomization unit. Matches paper baseline.

budgets.notes: Data not publicly available (SSA admin data). Core specs are primarily across outcomes, time periods, and control sets. Budget is moderate because the control pool is small and well-structured.

sampling.notes: Small control pool (lottery draw FE mandatory, optional: lagged outcome, lottery_list demographics). Full enumeration is feasible.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Balance of lottery_list characteristics across treatment and control (Table A3).
Match rate differential between treatment and control (Table A3 row 1).
First stage: treatment -> ohp_all_ever_ssa. Reported in Table A5.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Government benefit receipt (SNAP, TANF, SSI, SSDI indicators and amounts)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Intent-to-treat effect of Medicaid lottery selection on government benefit receipt
claim_object.target_population: Low-income uninsured adults in Oregon who signed up for Medicaid lottery, matched to SSA administrative data

constraints.notes: Same control structure as G1. Lottery draw FE always mandatory (8 dummies). Optional: lagged outcome (1), lottery_list demographics (9). Max = 18.

canonical.notes: Cluster at the household (reservation_id). Matches paper.

budgets.notes: More outcome variables than G1 (8 vs 3), but same control structure. Budget is moderate.

sampling.notes: Same as G1: small control pool, exhaustive enumeration.
